items.title: Coalition on brink as Nationals quit shadow ministry
items.description: Opposition leader Sussan Ley says the Nationals' mass resignation from her frontbench is "unnecessary" and has urged the rural party to remain in the Coalition.

items.title: Australian real estate prices set new records as Melbourne rebounds
items.description: Melbourne real estate market is making a "decisive recovery", according to property portal Domain, as the city hits a new record for its median house price for the first time in four years after strong growth across the country in 2025.

items.title: Neo-Nazis told to limit gathering sizes and coached to avoid arrest
items.description: Two groups in the sights of the government's new hate crackdown have moved to scrub their online profile.

items.title: Trump 'won't use force' to take Greenland, but says he wants 'immediate' deal
items.description: Donald Trump says he wants "immediate" negotiations to begin on selling Greenland to the United States, as tensions between his administration and European allies continue to rise.

items.title: 'Constant worry': Ukraine endures bitterest winter as Russia targets energy sites
items.description: The war-ravaged country has been plunged into an energy crisis as temperatures plummet below freezing, leaving millions unable to heat their homes.

items.title: Prince Harry says tabloids made wife Meghan's life 'absolute misery' in Daily Mail trial
items.description: An emotional Prince Harry held back tears as he described the impact of media coverage on his wife Meghan Markle.

items.title: De Minaur overcomes early scare to progress to third round
items.description: Alex de Minaur is the first local to progress into the third round of the Australian Open after four other Australians have been knocked out today.

items.title: Children and journalists among 11 people killed by Israel in Gaza
items.description: According to Palestinian medics, two boys aged 10 and 13 were among those killed on Wednesday in the latest violence which threatens to undermine a fragile ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.

items.title: How Australia will mark the National Day of Mourning for Bondi victims
items.description: Thursday will be a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack. Here's what you need to know.

items.title: Netanyahu agrees to join Trump's 'Board of Peace' as others say no
items.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to join US President Donald Trump's "Board of Peace" despite his office previously criticising the makeup of the executive committee.

items.title: K'gari traditional owners raise issues with dingo management after teen's death
items.description: The body of Piper James, 19, was found surrounded by dingoes on a beach on the island's eastern coast, but how she died may not be known for some time.

items.title: Landing attempt aborted after trespass incident at Melbourne Airport
items.description: A pilot is forced to abort a landing attempt at Melbourne Airport, and two take-offs are delayed after an alleged late-night trespassing incident.

items.title: World's biggest nuclear power plant restarts almost 15 years after Fukushima disaster
items.description: The world's biggest nuclear power plant has been rebooted by the same company that operated the Fukushima facility, despite concerns about safety from some locals.

items.title: Midnight Oil's Rob Hirst died of one of Australia's deadliest cancers
items.description: Rob Hirst was first diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023. It is estimated to be the third most common cause of cancer death in Australia, and has among the lowest survival rates.

items.title: You may want to think twice about submitting that ancestry DNA test
items.description: If you're thinking of taking an ancestry DNA test as "a bit of fun", experts warn there is the risk of uncovering more than you bargained for.

items.title: Hand stencils discovered in Indonesia are world's oldest-known rock art
items.description: Faint ochre outlines of hands thought to be at least 67,800 years old are the oldest rock art yet discovered. Archaeologists say the discovery of the Indonesian cave art backs up estimates of when humans first reached Australia.

items.title: Australian shark attack data reveals where bite incidents happen most
items.description: An ABC analysis of the national Shark-Incident Database shows that the average number of verified shark bite incidents recorded annually over a decade has increased every 10 years since the 1950s.

items.title: Beijing has a nickname for Trump: The Chinese 'nation-builder'
items.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

items.title: Australia's NATO envoy is returning home with a warning about North Korea
items.description: Australia's outgoing military envoy to NATO is preparing to return to Canberra after two years in the role, and she is coming home with a warning.

items.title: Prime minister's national security adviser Philippa Brant resigns
items.description: Philippa Brant has resigned just months after the PM's top foreign policy adviser departed to run the Office of National Intelligence.

items.title: 'Floating on a sea of cash': High hopes for WA towns as gold price soars
items.description: A Kalgoorlie miner hopes the soaring price of gold will incentivise investment into regional WA.

items.title: Court hears victim of alleged child neglect told to 'choose a coffin'
items.description: The father of a 15-year-old girl whose mother is accused of her manslaughter, tells the South Australian Supreme Court of a threat made against his daughter and punishment she was made to do.

items.title: New Alice Springs mayor will not take part in Australia Day celebrations
items.description: Asta Hill will not take part in celebrations of Australia Day, which she sees as a day causing harm to First Nations peoples — a decision described as "disgraceful" by the local member of the Northern Territory Legislative Assembly.

items.title: Police believe teacher's baby fathered by student she allegedly abused
items.description: Police believe a Mandurah teacher gave birth to a baby fathered by a student she allegedly sexually assaulted.

items.title: The public pool should be accessible for all — but for many, it isn't
items.description: A new exhibition in Western Sydney interrogates Australia's enduring love affair with the pool.
